issue.title: Methods pointing to the "uncustomizable" classes.
issue.body:
This allows people to use corresponding method calls like:

```
$builder = datatables()->eloquent($query);
```

instead of needing to use the `make` method.

```
$builder = datatables()->make($query);
```

Since only the `make` is using the classes from `datatables.engines`, the code is not consistent.

comment.body: Released on v10.2.0, thanks a lot! 🚀

pull_request.body:
This allows people to use corresponding method calls like:

```
$builder = datatables()->eloquent($query);

instead of needing to use the `make` method.

issue.title: How to change Datatable styling?
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

My datatable looks like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25293489/199201785-b9b919d9-4df3-4049-83c1-19bfd93f4ef4.png)

How can I change the styling of this sub-table plus icon and change its position? Something exactly like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25293489/199202066-d024783d-5d59-4c05-943c-4783beb6f3e9.png)

I am including my table into the blade like this:

```
<!--begin::Table-->
{{ $dataTable->table() }}
<!--end::Table-->

{{-- Inject Scripts --}}
@section('scripts')
    {{ $dataTable->scripts() }}
@endsection
```

When I look for solutions, all the answers are using pure JS and `<table>` which is not what I'm looking for.

### Here is the html method of the datatable

```
public function html()
    {
        return $this->builder()
            ->setTableId('reports-table')
            ->columns($this->getColumns())
            ->minifiedAjax()
            ->dom('t') // <"d-flex" Br> <ft> <"d-flex justify-content-between" lip>
            ->stateSave(true)
            ->responsive(true)
            ->autoWidth(false)
            ->orderBy(1)
            ->parameters([
                'scrollX' => false,
                'lengthMenu' => [
                    [10, 25, 50, 100, -1],
                    ['10 rows', '25 rows', '50 rows', '100 rows', 'Show all']
                ],
                'language' => [
                    // Search
                    'className' => 'form-control form-control-solid w-250px ps-14',
                    'searchPlaceholder' => 'Search Report',
                    'search' => theme()->getSvgIcon("demo8/media/icons/duotune/general/gen021.svg", "svg-icon-1"),
                ],
            ])
            ->addTableClass('table table-row-dashed fw-bold fs-5 text-gray-600');
    }
```

Note: I am using Metronic 8 Theme with this package.

### System details

- Operating System: Windows 11
- PHP Version: 8.1
- Laravel Version: 9
- Laravel-Datatables Version: 10

issue.title: Nested Relationships - sort & search error: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column
issue.body:
Currently, it seems that nested relationships are not fully supported (to be more precise - when having nested relationship, `sort` and `search` trigger `Column not found: 1054 Unknown column ...` error). 

I know that this is old issue but was wondering will there be any updates? :) Can we expect this to be supported anytime soon? If not, are there any work-around examples (I couldn't find anything in the documentation)?

It would be really good to support at least 1 level deep nested relationships (e.g. `thread.forum.name` - see below) because I think that would cover most of the cases (ideally, it would be best to support as much as possible, but I guess that's very complicated/tricky to implement).

### Summary of problem or feature request

There are 3 Eloquent models with the following relations:

- `Post` _belongsTo_ `Thread`
- `Thread` _belongsTo_ `Forum`

I am using Datatables to display **posts** with nested eager-loading:

```php
Post::select('posts.*')->with('thread.forum');
```

and I have `'thread.forum.name'` column:

```javascript
{ data: 'thread.forum.name', name: 'thread.forum.name' }
```


The forum names are displayed in Datatables, but when I try to order by the forum name (or search all searchable columns) - I'm getting the following error:

> SQLSTATE[42S22]: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column 'thread.forum.name' in 'order clause' (SQL: select `posts`.* from `posts` order by `thread`.`forum`.`name` asc limit 10 offset 0)

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18264428/47388243-fe8efe00-d711-11e8-9d71-39c3c0935f61.png)

So, I have to disable _search_ and _sort_ functionalities on this column (by adding `orderable: false, searchable: false`).

### System details

- PHP Version: 7.2 
- Laravel Version: 6 LTS
- Laravel-Datatables Version: *9.11.1*

issue.title: Double count queries on v10
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->
Hello there, 
I want to upgrade our `laravel-databales` version from v9 to the latest version,
however after upgrade, we feel like it slower than v9 and after take a look to the query it has double query for count query

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83449781/196865945-49b53478-d28a-42f0-b623-a8c42ae840c3.png)

The first and sec query look exactly same for me, Not sure if these are expected ?

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System : Windows 10 & Ubuntu
- PHP Version : 8.1
- Laravel Version : 9.36.2
- Laravel-Datatables Version : 10.1.6

comment.body: @omadijaya this is actually an expected behavior since the first count is for the total records and the next one is for the total filtered records. However, it was optimized on the previous version but had to be removed to fix several issues. There was a recent PR that attempts to fix this https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/pull/2852 but the tests are failing so I cannot merge it yet.

issue.title: ReadOnly is a reserved word in PHP 8.1
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request
readonly is a reserved keyword in PHP 8.1. Any existing classes or other symbols that use the name readonly (case insensitive) will result in a syntax error in PHP 8.1.

It is not possible to port the readonly functionality to older PHP versions.
<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->

### Code snippet of problem
```
<?php

namespace Yajra\DataTables\Html\Editor\Fields;

class ReadOnly extends Field
{
    protected $type = 'readonly';
}
```



<!--
If applicable, please include a copy of your code
which triggers the suspected bug.

You may use the markdown php code tags to format your paste:

```php
$params = ['foo'];
```
-->

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System  Ubuntu 22.04
- PHP Version  8.1.2
- Laravel Version  9 latest
- Laravel-Datatables Version Latest

I have fixed this by changing "ReadOnly" to "ReadOnlyProp", which works for me, but I haven't done any testing.

issue.title: Methods pointing to the "uncustomizable" classes.
issue.body:
This allows people to use corresponding method calls like:

```
$builder = datatables()->eloquent($query);
```

instead of needing to use the `make` method.

```
$builder = datatables()->make($query);
```

Since only the `make` is using the classes from `datatables.engines`, the code is not consistent.

issue.title: How to change Datatable styling?
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

My datatable looks like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25293489/199201785-b9b919d9-4df3-4049-83c1-19bfd93f4ef4.png)

How can I change the styling of this sub-table plus icon and change its position? Something exactly like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25293489/199202066-d024783d-5d59-4c05-943c-4783beb6f3e9.png)

I am including my table into the blade like this:

```
<!--begin::Table-->
{{ $dataTable->table() }}
<!--end::Table-->

{{-- Inject Scripts --}}
@section('scripts')
    {{ $dataTable->scripts() }}
@endsection
```

When I look for solutions, all the answers are using pure JS and `<table>` which is not what I'm looking for.

### Here is the html method of the datatable

```
public function html()
    {
        return $this->builder()
            ->setTableId('reports-table')
            ->columns($this->getColumns())
            ->minifiedAjax()
            ->dom('t') // <"d-flex" Br> <ft> <"d-flex justify-content-between" lip>
            ->stateSave(true)
            ->responsive(true)
            ->autoWidth(false)
            ->orderBy(1)
            ->parameters([
                'scrollX' => false,
                'lengthMenu' => [
                    [10, 25, 50, 100, -1],
                    ['10 rows', '25 rows', '50 rows', '100 rows', 'Show all']
                ],
                'language' => [
                    // Search
                    'className' => 'form-control form-control-solid w-250px ps-14',
                    'searchPlaceholder' => 'Search Report',
                    'search' => theme()->getSvgIcon("demo8/media/icons/duotune/general/gen021.svg", "svg-icon-1"),
                ],
            ])
            ->addTableClass('table table-row-dashed fw-bold fs-5 text-gray-600');
    }
```

Note: I am using Metronic 8 Theme with this package.

### System details

- Operating System: Windows 11
- PHP Version: 8.1
- Laravel Version: 9
- Laravel-Datatables Version: 10

issue.title: Nested Relationships - sort & search error: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column
issue.body:
Currently, it seems that nested relationships are not fully supported (to be more precise - when having nested relationship, `sort` and `search` trigger `Column not found: 1054 Unknown column ...` error). 

I know that this is old issue but was wondering will there be any updates? :) Can we expect this to be supported anytime soon? If not, are there any work-around examples (I couldn't find anything in the documentation)?

It would be really good to support at least 1 level deep nested relationships (e.g. `thread.forum.name` - see below) because I think that would cover most of the cases (ideally, it would be best to support as much as possible, but I guess that's very complicated/tricky to implement).

### Summary of problem or feature request

There are 3 Eloquent models with the following relations:

- `Post` _belongsTo_ `Thread`
- `Thread` _belongsTo_ `Forum`

I am using Datatables to display **posts** with nested eager-loading:

```php
Post::select('posts.*')->with('thread.forum');
```

and I have `'thread.forum.name'` column:

```javascript
{ data: 'thread.forum.name', name: 'thread.forum.name' }
```


The forum names are displayed in Datatables, but when I try to order by the forum name (or search all searchable columns) - I'm getting the following error:

> SQLSTATE[42S22]: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column 'thread.forum.name' in 'order clause' (SQL: select `posts`.* from `posts` order by `thread`.`forum`.`name` asc limit 10 offset 0)

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18264428/47388243-fe8efe00-d711-11e8-9d71-39c3c0935f61.png)

So, I have to disable _search_ and _sort_ functionalities on this column (by adding `orderable: false, searchable: false`).

### System details

- PHP Version: 7.2 
- Laravel Version: 6 LTS
- Laravel-Datatables Version: *9.11.1*

issue.title: Double count queries on v10
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->
Hello there, 
I want to upgrade our `laravel-databales` version from v9 to the latest version,
however after upgrade, we feel like it slower than v9 and after take a look to the query it has double query for count query

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83449781/196865945-49b53478-d28a-42f0-b623-a8c42ae840c3.png)

The first and sec query look exactly same for me, Not sure if these are expected ?

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System : Windows 10 & Ubuntu
- PHP Version : 8.1
- Laravel Version : 9.36.2
- Laravel-Datatables Version : 10.1.6

comment.body: @omadijaya this is actually an expected behavior since the first count is for the total records and the next one is for the total filtered records. However, it was optimized on the previous version but had to be removed to fix several issues. There was a recent PR that attempts to fix this https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/pull/2852 but the tests are failing so I cannot merge it yet.

issue.title: ReadOnly is a reserved word in PHP 8.1
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request
readonly is a reserved keyword in PHP 8.1. Any existing classes or other symbols that use the name readonly (case insensitive) will result in a syntax error in PHP 8.1.

It is not possible to port the readonly functionality to older PHP versions.
<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->

### Code snippet of problem
```
<?php

namespace Yajra\DataTables\Html\Editor\Fields;

class ReadOnly extends Field
{
    protected $type = 'readonly';
}
```



<!--
If applicable, please include a copy of your code
which triggers the suspected bug.

You may use the markdown php code tags to format your paste:

```php
$params = ['foo'];
```
-->

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System  Ubuntu 22.04
- PHP Version  8.1.2
- Laravel Version  9 latest
- Laravel-Datatables Version Latest

I have fixed this by changing "ReadOnly" to "ReadOnlyProp", which works for me, but I haven't done any testing.

Site Link: https://next.yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/9.0/html-installation 
GitHub Document Link: https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables-docs/blob/9.0/html-installation.md

Site Pattern: `{site_url}/docs/{package}/{version}/{document}`
GitHub Pattern: `https://github.com/yajra/{package}-docs/blob/{version}/{document}.md`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25293489/199202066-d024783d-5d59-4c05-943c-4783beb6f3e9.png)

I am including my table into the blade like this:

```
<!--begin::Table-->
{{ $dataTable->table() }}
<!--end::Table-->

{{-- Inject Scripts --}}
@section('scripts')
    {{ $dataTable->scripts() }}
@endsection
```

When I look for solutions, all the answers are using pure JS and `<table>` which is not what I'm looking for.

### Here is the html method of the datatable

```
public function html()
    {
        return $this->builder()
            ->setTableId('reports-table')
            ->columns($this->getColumns())
            ->minifiedAjax()
            ->dom('t') // <"d-flex" Br> <ft> <"d-flex justify-content-between" lip>
            ->stateSave(true)
            ->responsive(true)
            ->autoWidth(false)
            ->orderBy(1)
            ->parameters([
                'scrollX' => false,
                'lengthMenu' => [
                    [10, 25, 50, 100, -1],
                    ['10 rows', '25 rows', '50 rows', '100 rows', 'Show all']
                ],
                'language' => [
                    // Search
                    'className' => 'form-control form-control-solid w-250px ps-14',
                    'searchPlaceholder' => 'Search Report',
                    'search' => theme()->getSvgIcon("demo8/media/icons/duotune/general/gen021.svg", "svg-icon-1"),
                ],
            ])
            ->addTableClass('table table-row-dashed fw-bold fs-5 text-gray-600');
    }
```

Note: I am using Metronic 8 Theme with this package.

### System details

- Operating System: Windows 11
- PHP Version: 8.1
- Laravel Version: 9
- Laravel-Datatables Version: 10

issue.title: Nested Relationships - sort & search error: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column
issue.body:
Currently, it seems that nested relationships are not fully supported (to be more precise - when having nested relationship, `sort` and `search` trigger `Column not found: 1054 Unknown column ...` error). 

I know that this is old issue but was wondering will there be any updates? :) Can we expect this to be supported anytime soon? If not, are there any work-around examples (I couldn't find anything in the documentation)?

It would be really good to support at least 1 level deep nested relationships (e.g. `thread.forum.name` - see below) because I think that would cover most of the cases (ideally, it would be best to support as much as possible, but I guess that's very complicated/tricky to implement).

### Summary of problem or feature request

There are 3 Eloquent models with the following relations:

- `Post` _belongsTo_ `Thread`
- `Thread` _belongsTo_ `Forum`

I am using Datatables to display **posts** with nested eager-loading:

```php
Post::select('posts.*')->with('thread.forum');
```

and I have `'thread.forum.name'` column:

```javascript
{ data: 'thread.forum.name', name: 'thread.forum.name' }
```


The forum names are displayed in Datatables, but when I try to order by the forum name (or search all searchable columns) - I'm getting the following error:

> SQLSTATE[42S22]: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column 'thread.forum.name' in 'order clause' (SQL: select `posts`.* from `posts` order by `thread`.`forum`.`name` asc limit 10 offset 0)

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18264428/47388243-fe8efe00-d711-11e8-9d71-39c3c0935f61.png)

So, I have to disable _search_ and _sort_ functionalities on this column (by adding `orderable: false, searchable: false`).

### System details

- PHP Version: 7.2 
- Laravel Version: 6 LTS
- Laravel-Datatables Version: *9.11.1*

issue.title: Double count queries on v10
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->
Hello there, 
I want to upgrade our `laravel-databales` version from v9 to the latest version,
however after upgrade, we feel like it slower than v9 and after take a look to the query it has double query for count query

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83449781/196865945-49b53478-d28a-42f0-b623-a8c42ae840c3.png)

The first and sec query look exactly same for me, Not sure if these are expected ?

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System : Windows 10 & Ubuntu
- PHP Version : 8.1
- Laravel Version : 9.36.2
- Laravel-Datatables Version : 10.1.6

comment.body: @omadijaya this is actually an expected behavior since the first count is for the total records and the next one is for the total filtered records. However, it was optimized on the previous version but had to be removed to fix several issues. There was a recent PR that attempts to fix this https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/pull/2852 but the tests are failing so I cannot merge it yet.

issue.title: ReadOnly is a reserved word in PHP 8.1
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request
readonly is a reserved keyword in PHP 8.1. Any existing classes or other symbols that use the name readonly (case insensitive) will result in a syntax error in PHP 8.1.

It is not possible to port the readonly functionality to older PHP versions.
<!-- Please describe your problem/feature request here. -->

### Code snippet of problem
```
<?php

namespace Yajra\DataTables\Html\Editor\Fields;

class ReadOnly extends Field
{
    protected $type = 'readonly';
}
```



<!--
If applicable, please include a copy of your code
which triggers the suspected bug.

You may use the markdown php code tags to format your paste:

```php
$params = ['foo'];
```
-->

### System details

<!--
Please include these details about your system!
If they are omitted, the ticket will be deprioritized
over other users requests/tickets.
-->

- Operating System  Ubuntu 22.04
- PHP Version  8.1.2
- Laravel Version  9 latest
- Laravel-Datatables Version Latest

I have fixed this by changing "ReadOnly" to "ReadOnlyProp", which works for me, but I haven't done any testing.

It would be nice to give the user the ability to contribute in the documentation by providing them an edit link to its corresponding GitHub document.

Site Link: https://next.yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/9.0/html-installation 
GitHub Document Link: https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables-docs/blob/9.0/html-installation.md

Site Pattern: `{site_url}/docs/{package}/{version}/{document}`
GitHub Pattern: `https://github.com/yajra/{package}-docs/blob/{version}/{document}.md`
